intro: Cnemidaria nervosa, commonly known as the slender nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs and its alternate, ovate leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Cnemidaria nervosa is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
